<kevaundray> > <kevaundray>  RE your comments on blacklisting; so instead of permanently banning those who timeout of the lobby X times, we allow them to enter and exit freely, and only those who get to the contribution spot and are messing about get permananently banned.

I think this also means less code and yeah would be a better UX for those who have bad connections, so sounds good to me (re @Grzegorz: sequencer's persistent state PR: https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-sequencer/pull/13)

author: bridge-bot
content: <Grzegorz> exactly. we only care about timeouts if they were chosen to contribute

author: bridge-bot
content: <Grzegorz> the risk here is when we have a big number of users who login and immediately leave the page (time out) to make the lobby full

author: bridge-bot
content: <Grzegorz> but I think we wanted to have quite large lobby limits anyway, and this risk is partially mitigated by sybil checks anyway
